name: cute
content:
cute adjective
(ATTRACTIVE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(especially of something or someone small or young) pleasant and attractive: His baby brother is really cute.

cute adjective
(ANNOYING)
US trying to be clever, sometimes in a rude or unpleasant way: Don't be cute with me, Vicki.

Related words
cutely
cuteness
the cutes
informal behaviour , a performance, etc. that is cute, especially in a way that people find stupid or annoying: This is a production with an exaggerated case of the cutes.
See more
cute adjective [-er/-est only]
(CHARMING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(esp. of something or someone small or young) charming and attractive: She was a really cute baby.
Something described as cute is attractive and pleasant: She had a cute apartment with a little garden.
cute adjective [-er/-est only]
(DECEIVING)
disapproving too carefully designed to get approval or appear attractive, and therefore seeming dishonest: [ + to infinitive ] He thinks it’s cute to misbehave, but it’s not.
